metadata.description: Expanded knowledge base for comprehensive geDIG evaluation v2

associations.text: Addition is the process of combining two or more numbers to get their total sum
Subtraction is taking away one number from another to find the difference
Multiplication is repeated addition of the same number
Division is splitting a number into equal parts
A fraction represents a part of a whole, written as numerator over denominator
To add fractions, they must have the same denominator
Decimals are another way to represent fractions, using base-10 notation
Multiplying by 0.5 is the same as dividing by 2
In algebra, variables like x and y represent unknown values
An equation shows that two expressions are equal
Matter exists in three common states: solid, liquid, and gas
Water freezes at 0 degrees Celsius and boils at 100 degrees Celsius
When water is cooled below 0°C, it becomes ice (solid state)
When water is heated above 100°C, it becomes steam (gas state)
Chemical elements are represented by symbols: H for hydrogen, O for oxygen
Gold has the chemical symbol Au, from its Latin name aurum
Silver has the chemical symbol Ag, from its Latin name argentum
Iron has the chemical symbol Fe, from its Latin name ferrum
Plants use photosynthesis to convert sunlight into energy
Animals adapt to their environment through evolution
A cactus stores water to survive in desert conditions
Penguins have thick blubber to survive in arctic environments
Density is mass divided by volume
When matter is compressed, its density increases
Temperature affects the volume of substances
Gravity pulls objects toward the center of Earth
Nouns are words that name people, places, things, or ideas
Verbs are words that describe actions or states of being
Adjectives are words that describe or modify nouns
Adverbs modify verbs, adjectives, or other adverbs
Most English nouns form plurals by adding -s or -es
Some nouns have irregular plurals: child becomes children
Mouse becomes mice in the plural form
Some nouns don't change in plural: sheep, deer, fish
An idiom is a phrase with a figurative meaning different from its literal meaning
Break the ice means to start a conversation in a social situation
Piece of cake means something is very easy to do
Spill the beans means to reveal a secret
A syllogism is a logical argument with two premises and a conclusion
If all A are B, and X is an A, then X must be B
If-then statements show cause and effect relationships
When it rains on dry ground, the ground becomes wet
A paradox is a statement that seems contradictory but may be true
The more you learn, the more you realize how much you don't know
Colors are visual perceptions of different wavelengths of light
Apples are typically red, green, or yellow
Bananas are yellow when ripe
The sky appears blue due to light scattering
Grass is green due to chlorophyll
Analogies compare relationships between different pairs of things
Teacher is to student as doctor is to patient
Painter is to canvas as writer is to paper
Seed is to tree as egg is to bird
A custom operation can be defined with specific rules
Functions can be composed: f(g(x)) applies g then f
Entropy measures disorder in a system
Information theory relates to entropy and complexity
Etymology is the study of word origins and how meanings change
Understand comes from under + stand, originally meaning to stand among
Abstract concepts can be explained through concrete metaphors
Democracy is like a garden that needs constant tending
